Posted on October 25, 2015

I’ve already posted previously on “house effects”, the tendency of polling organizations to systematically vary in their results from one another. In this post, I look specifically at these house effects, and show which polling organizations over or under-estimate support for each candidate–compared to the average–in this presidential election...
